summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of an individual (name redacted) conducted on August 19, 2020. The interviewee describes his past relationship with a woman (name redacted) who worked for Jeffrey Epstein as a traveling massage therapist, his role in recruiting other girls for Epstein, and his limited interactions with Ghislaine Maxwell. The document details the recruitment process, payments, and the nature of the operation.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Deposed the interviewee approximately five years prior regarding a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a lawsuit for which the interviewee was deposed. The interviewee states he met her a handful of times, and that she and the interviewee's girlfriend would go out and get girls together for Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Wealthy individual for whom the interviewee's girlfriend worked as a traveling massage therapist. The interviewee recruited girls for him, was paid by him, and had direct interactions with him.

connections.description: According to the interviewee, Maxwell and the interviewee's girlfriend would go out and get girls together for Epstein.
Edwards deposed a witness in a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell, which is connected to the Epstein case.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: An individual was interviewed via video conference by a detective and an FBI Special Agent regarding his knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and a recruitment operation for massage therapists.

events.title: Deposition for Maxwell Lawsuit
events.description: The interviewee was deposed by attorney Brad Edwards for a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Epstein's First Incarceration
events.description: The interviewee recalls speaking with the FBI around the time Jeffrey Epstein first went to jail.

locations: the Island (likely referring to Little St. James)
keyFacts: The interviewee's girlfriend worked for Jeffrey Epstein as a traveling massage therapist, accompanying him for two weeks at a time to locations like Santa Fe, New York, and an island.
The interviewee recruited girls for Epstein, telling them a man liked massages, and was paid $200 in cash per girl he brought to Epstein's residence.
The interviewee stated that his girlfriend and Ghislaine Maxwell were sexually active with each other and would go out together to get girls for Epstein.
Epstein gave instructions to the interviewee to ensure recruited girls were 18 years old and 'not fat.'

The document references a prior FBI statement (31E-MM-108062 serial #104) where the interviewee allegedly said Maxwell would call him to pick up specific girls, though in this interview he did not fully recall that statement.
